title: (x) J-Town Pre-School, Inc. casual caps - Cartoon Bold {Mike F}
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080511225354im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/jtown_3490.jpg)

 [‹ Evolução Gastronómica wide tech geometric display sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20080511225354/http:/www.typophile.com/node/37207 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Serif face in Herb Lubalin book - Jenson (pre-digital) {Mark S} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080511225354/http:/www.typophile.com/node/37438 "Go to next forum topic")
author: signs79

comments.content: This is very familiar, but I can’t remember. It looks like a Bitstream font.

Cartoon Bold was the original (predigital) name. There are various, mostly poorly made versions out there. Fontbank (long defunct) digitized it as [Caricature](http://web.archive.org/web/20080511225354/http:/www.buyfonts.com/value_for_money/caricature.htm) (and the Xara folks claim to have the rights to the Fontbank fonts now).

It also appeared on CorelDraw CDs as ’Cancun’.

You are right. I bought a Corel CD that has Bistream fonts on it including Cancun.

Thanks.
